content.text: DRO is Deakin University's institutional digital repository for publications, research, and teaching materials. Deposited material covers a very wide range of subjects and disciplines. The repository holds the full text of many peer-reviewed published articles and conference papers, as well as book chapters, theses and other forms of written research from DU academic staff and postgraduate students. It contains working and discussion papers, technical reports and some preprints. Research datasets, sound and image collections, multimedia, software and other forms of research data are also held. Learning objects and other course-related materials are welcome. http://dro.deakin.edu.au/

metadataPolicy.text: DRO metadata are freely accessible to all, and freely re-useable by all, under the following conditions: (1) The full name(s) of the author(s) and (2) the full bibliographic reference information for the paper (date, title, and, if published, publisher, if any, full name of journal or conference proceedings, volume, issue/number and pages, if any) must always co-appear prominently with any re-use or redisplay of the metadata, in any medium. The metadata may not be offered for sale without the formal permission of the author and publisher. (Note: DRO is NOT the publisher; it is merely the online archive that hosts the papers. Attribution of DRO when re-using any metadata is required.)

dataPolicy.text: The repository accepts research output in the following formats: * pre-prints * working papers * published articles (post-prints) * books and monographs * book chapters * online journals * research reports * draft or final conference papers * conference posters * data sets * theses * any other form of research output which can be technically loaded to the repository.

submissionPolicy.text: DRO is a repository for the self-archiving, by their authors (or, by authorised second parties, or, if the papers are in the public domain, by anyone), of research papers in any discipline by academic staff and postgraduate students of the . Papers can be (1) refereed, accepted, published final drafts (post-prints) or (2) unrefereed drafts prior to publication (pre-prints). Deposits will be vetted by DRO for provenance and completeness; they will not be otherwise validated or authenticated. Responsibility for the validity and authenticity of the content of these self-archived papers rests entirely with the depositor. Any copyright violations are also entirely the responsibility of the depositor. (DRO, if it receives proof of copyright violation, will immediately remove the paper in question.)

eprints.comment: This system is running Fez server software (Fez ) developed at the University of Queensland. For more information see https://github.com/uqlibrary/fez
